sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Insider Selling: LiveWire Group (NYSE:LVWR) Insider Sells 4,199 Shares of Stock
feed.summary: Jon Bekefy, CEO of LiveWire Group (NYSE:LVWR), sold 4,199 shares of the company's stock on December 5, 2025, for approximately $16,880. This transaction reduced his holding by 3.47% to 116,749 shares. The company has weak fundamentals with a negative EPS and net margin, and an average analyst rating of "Sell."

feed.title: LiveWire Group (NYSE:LVWR) Shares Gap Down - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: LiveWire Group (NYSE:LVWR) shares gapped down on Monday, falling from $4.48 to $4.19 at open and trading at $4.1550 on light volume. The company remains unprofitable, with a negative ROE and net margin, and analysts maintain a consensus "Sell" rating on the stock. Several institutional investors, including Vanguard Group Inc., have recently adjusted their holdings in LVWR.

feed.title: LiveWire Group (LVWR) officer discloses equity award vesting and tax withholding on Form 4
feed.summary: An officer at LiveWire Group, the Head of Product Development & Design, reported equity transactions including the acquisition of 2,564 shares of common stock upon the vesting of performance stock units on December 2, 2025. On the same day, the officer surrendered 2,288 and 1,009 shares to cover tax withholding obligations related to the vesting of restricted and performance stock units, respectively. Following these transactions, the insider beneficially owns 144,911 shares, including 130,621 unvested restricted stock units.

feed.title: Officer Ragland Disposes 733 Of LiveWire Group Inc [LVWR]
feed.summary: Officer Ryan Ragland of LiveWire Group Inc. (LVWR) filed a Form 4 on December 4, 2025, detailing changes in his ownership. The filing shows an exercise of 2,564 shares and a surrender of 3,297 shares on December 2, 2025, leaving him with 144,911 direct holdings. The shares were surrendered to cover option exercise costs and/or tax liabilities.

feed.title: LiveWire Group (LVWR) officer adjusts stake as RSUs and PSUs vest
feed.summary: An officer at LiveWire Group (LVWR), the Head of Global Sales & Marketing, adjusted their stock holdings on December 2, 2025. This involved acquiring 2,486 shares from vested performance units and surrendering a total of 3,924 shares to cover tax obligations related to both restricted and performance stock unit vesting. Following these transactions, the executive directly holds 120,948 shares, including 110,749 unvested restricted stock units.

feed.title: LiveWire sees success with discounting strategy
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, controlled by Harley-Davidson, has seen a sales spike due to a new discounting strategy for its electric motorcycles. The company plans to continue this strategy for the next two weeks. This article provides a preview of insights into LiveWire's successful approach.

feed.title: LiveWire Group, Inc. (NYSE:LVWR) May Have Run Too Fast Too Soon With Recent 33% Price Plummet
feed.summary: LiveWire Group's stock (NYSE:LVWR) recently dropped 33%, leaving shareholders with a 38% loss over the past year. Despite this, its price-to-sales ratio of 31.5x remains significantly higher than the industry average of 0.8x, raising concerns given its 19% revenue decline last year and 50% decrease over the last three years. The article suggests that investors might be overvaluing the company, especially as the rest of the auto industry is projected to grow by 10% in the next year.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: LiveWire Group Inc reports Q3 2025 loss, stock drops 6%
feed.summary: LiveWire Group Inc. (LVWR) reported a Q3 2025 loss with an EPS of -$0.10 and revenue of $5.7 million, causing its stock to drop over 6% in pre-market trading. This financial downturn and the absence of forward guidance raise investor concerns about the company's profitability and future prospects. Harley-Davidson executives, including CEO Ardeep Starrs and CFO Jonathan Root, discussed strategies to improve dealer health, manage inventory, and leverage the HDFS transaction to unlock cash and drive future growth.

feed.title: LiveWire Group, Inc. To Report Third Quarter 2025 Results on November 4, 2025
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. (NYSE: LVWR) announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results on November 4, 2025, before market hours. The company will host an audio webcast from 8-9 a.m. CT to discuss its financial results, business developments, and outlook, with registration required 10 minutes prior. A replay of the webcast will be available approximately two hours after the live event.

feed.title: LiveWire and c.technology to deliver Next-Generation Connected Experience for electric motorcycles
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. and c.technology AG are collaborating to develop a cutting-edge connected platform for LiveWire electric motorcycle owners in North America and Europe. This partnership will introduce an advanced mobile and web application suite providing real-time vehicle data, location-based features, and community engagement tools. The initiative aims to enhance the connected functionality of LiveWire ONE and Harley-Davidson's LiveWire models, offering a robust and future-ready ecosystem for EV riders.

feed.title: LiveWire Group (NYSE:LVWR) Trading 7.1% Higher - What's Next? - MarketBeat
feed.summary: LiveWire Group's stock (NYSE:LVWR) saw a 7.1% increase in mid-day trading, though with significantly lower than average volume. Analysts have mixed views, with an average "sell" rating despite a recent upgrade to "hold" by Wall Street Zen. The company continues to face financial challenges, reporting a negative net margin and EPS in its last quarterly earnings.

feed.title: LiveWire Group, Inc. To Report Third Quarter 2025 Results on November 4, 2025 - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. announced it will release its third quarter 2025 financial results on November 4, 2025, before market hours, followed by a webcast conference call at 8 a.m. CT. The company, majority-owned by Harley-Davidson, Inc., focuses on the electric motorcycle sector.

feed.title: LiveWire Group, Inc. To Report Third Quarter 2025 Results on November 4, 2025 - The Joplin Globe
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. (NYSE: LVWR) announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results on November 4, 2025, before market hours. A public audio webcast will be held from 8-9 a.m. CT to discuss these results, business developments, and company outlook. LiveWire is majority-owned by Harley-Davidson, Inc. and focuses on the electric motorcycle sector.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Harley-Davidson Q2 2025 sees 19% revenue decline - Investing.com UK
feed.summary: This article indicates that Harley-Davidson experienced a 19% revenue decline in Q2 2025, as revealed in an earnings call transcript. However, due to an application error, the full details of the earnings call are not available. The content primarily highlights the revenue decline and an error preventing the display of further information.

feed.title: LiveWire Group, Inc.'s (NYSE:LVWR) 37% Share Price Surge Not Quite Adding Up
feed.summary: LiveWire Group's stock surged 37% recently, but this gain barely offsets a 19% decline over the past year. The company's high Price-to-Sales (P/S) ratio of 38.4x is concerning given its recent revenue decline of 31% last year and 44% over three years, contrasting with the Auto industry's expected 10% expansion. This suggests the current valuation may be unsustainable if revenue trends continue to disappoint.

feed.title: LiveWire® Announces the Twist & Go Promotion and New Features Update for S2 Electric Motorcycles
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. has announced the "Twist & Go Promotion," offering significant pricing incentives on its entire S2 electric motorcycle lineup from August 28 to October 31, 2025. Concurrently, LiveWire is rolling out a software update for all S2 models, introducing new features: Reverse and Roll-Forward Regenerative Braking. These initiatives aim to enhance accessibility and the riding experience for electric motorcycle enthusiasts.

feed.title: LiveWire Sets Q2 Earnings Date: Harley's Electric Motorcycle Unit to Report Latest Financial Results
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. (NYSE: LVWR) will release its second-quarter 2025 financial results on July 30, 2025, before market hours. The company will host an audio webcast from 8-9 a.m. CT to discuss financial results, business developments, and updates to its outlook, with participants encouraged to register beforehand. LiveWire, majority-owned by Harley-Davidson, Inc., focuses on the electric motorcycle sector.

feed.title: Something Weird Is Happening at LiveWire. What's Up With Its Stock?
feed.summary: LiveWire (LVWR) experienced a significant stock price fluctuation in May-June 2025, rising from $1.01 to $7.48 per share without apparent public news. SEC filings reveal multiple resignations of key personnel, including the CFO and a lead independent director, and a substantial sell-off of shares by executives and board members, prompting questions about the company's future despite their retained holdings. The article highlights a discrepancy between the stock's performance and the lack of positive public announcements, coupled with insider selling.

feed.title: Why LiveWire Group, Inc. (LVWR) Surged Last Week
feed.summary: LiveWire Group, Inc. (LVWR) surged 345% last week, with shares jumping 56.79% on Friday, closing at $4.5. The company, an electric motorcycle manufacturer, narrowed its net loss in Q1 but saw revenues decrease. Despite the surge, the article suggests that some AI stocks may offer greater promise and lower risk.

feed.title: Surging Stocks: Why LiveWire Group Is Soaring
feed.summary: LiveWire Group Inc. (NYSE: LVWR) stock surged by 68.29%, driven by innovations in electric vehicle technology and investor optimism. Despite a net loss of $19.27M, the company shows strong liquidity and capitalization for future ventures, challenging traditional financial caution. Experts emphasize disciplined trading and seizing new opportunities in the volatile market.

feed.title: LiveWire Stock Surge: Is The Rally Sustainable?
feed.summary: LiveWire Group Inc. (LVWR) stock surged 33.16% due to strong market interest following an unexpected announcement of a new electric motorcycle and positive impacts from government incentives for EVs. While the company reported a significant loss of $19M, its revenue of $26M and robust cash reserves of $46M suggest potential for growth. Analysts and traders are cautiously optimistic, emphasizing risk management and adapting to immediate trends given the company's historical volatility and the emerging nature of the electric mobility market.

feed.title: Harley-Davidson takes on more functions for LiveWire
feed.summary: Harley-Davidson will begin to outsource numerous corporate services for its money-losing electric motorcycle subsidiary, LiveWire Group Inc., starting in 2025. This move suggests a deeper integration or support role from the parent company for LiveWire's operations. The article indicates LiveWire has been experiencing financial losses.

feed.title: LiveWire® & KYMCO Strengthen Strategic Partnership with New Agreement to Expand LiveWire’s S2 Portfolio
feed.summary: LiveWire and KYMCO have expanded their strategic partnership to develop an electric maxi-scooter, primarily for the European market, leveraging LiveWire's S2 powertrain and KYMCO's expertise. The collaboration aims to launch LiveWire's first electric maxi-scooter in the first half of 2026, building on their existing agreement from 2022. This initiative combines LiveWire's electric performance with KYMCO's experience in the scooter category to create a new premium electric offering.

feed.title: Harley-Davidson Faces Q3 Losses Amid Slumping Sales
feed.summary: Harley-Davidson is experiencing significant Q3 losses due to slumping sales, high interest rates, and consumer caution. The company's consolidated revenue dropped by 26%, with Harley-Davidson Motor Co. seeing a 32% revenue decrease. Revised forecasts now project a 14-16% loss in revenue and a 7-10% decline in retail sales for the full year.

feed.title: Five Takeaways From Harley-Davidson’s Q3 2024 Results
feed.summary: Harley-Davidson reported a significant 26% decline in total revenue for Q3 2024, with worldwide retail motorcycle sales down 13%. This downturn is attributed to high interest rates, macroeconomic, and political uncertainty, affecting the broader motorcycle industry. Despite overall poor performance, new CVO and touring models showed growth, and LiveWire, while still operating at a loss, saw increased unit sales of electric motorcycles and is working on cost reduction and new product offerings.

feed.title: Harley-Davidson's LiveWire cutting more costs amid continuing losses
feed.summary: Harley-Davidson's electric motorcycle subdivision, LiveWire, is implementing further cost-cutting measures due to ongoing losses, despite an increase in unit sales during its latest quarter. The company's sales figures are still significantly below its initial predictions.

feed.title: LiveWire reports 86% sales increase in Q1
feed.summary: LiveWire Group reported an 86% increase in Q1 2024 sales, selling 117 electric bikes, up from 63 in Q1 2023, driven by the launch of the S2 Mulholland. Despite the sales growth, the company continues to operate at a loss but anticipates an improved operating loss for the full year 2024, expecting 1,000 to 1,500 unit sales. LiveWire aims to reduce costs and leverage synergies by consolidating operations at Harley-Davidson's headquarters.

feed.title: LiveWire Group will move into historic Harley-Davidson HQ in Milwaukee
feed.summary: LiveWire Group Inc., an electric motorcycle firm owned by Harley-Davidson Inc., will consolidate its operations by moving into Harley-Davidson's historic but largely unused Milwaukee headquarters. This move will bring together staff currently located in Wauwatosa and California.

feed.title: Harley-Davidson Profit Beats Estimates Despite Lower Sales
feed.summary: Harley-Davidson Inc. reported a fourth-quarter profit of 18 cents per share, surpassing analyst estimates despite a significant drop in motorcycle sales to $792 million. The company expects revenue for 2024 to range from flat to down 9%, with UBS noting that sales were only maintained through "price slashing" amidst high borrowing costs.

feed.title: LiveWire Rallies 11% In Morning Trade
feed.summary: Shares of LiveWire Group, Inc. (LVWR) are up over 11% on Monday morning without any specific news. LiveWire, a spin-off of Harley-Davidson's electric motorcycle division, debuted on the NYSE on September 27 at $9.00 and had been trending downwards since. The stock is currently trading at $8.01.

feed.title: LiveWire Ready To Launch S2 Del Mar Production Model
feed.summary: LiveWire is preparing to launch the production model of its S2 Del Mar electric motorcycle, with the flat-track-styled bike expected to arrive in the spring of 2023. The article announces that LiveWire has opened order books for this new model.

feed.title: LiveWire™ Readies Latest S2 Del Mar™ Electric Motorcycle
feed.summary: LiveWire is opening reservations for the production version of its all-electric S2 Del Mar™ motorcycle, with deliveries expected in spring 2023. This model features the new ARROW architecture, boasting 80 horsepower, a 0-60 mph time of 3.1 seconds, and a targeted city range of 110 miles, priced at an MSRP of $16,999. The company emphasizes its ambition to lead the EV space and electrify motorcycling.

feed.title: Harley completes spinoff of LiveWire into public company
feed.summary: Harley-Davidson has successfully spun off its electric motorcycle division, LiveWire, into a separate publicly traded company, LiveWire Group Inc., which began trading on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker LVWR. The transaction generated $334 million in gross proceeds for LiveWire, with Harley retaining a majority stake. LiveWire aims to become the most desirable electric motorcycle brand globally, despite reporting over $202 million in net losses in its first three years, with much of its revenue coming from balance bikes rather than electric motorcycles.

feed.title: LiveWire S2 Del Mar Production Bike Officially Opens Reservations In U.S.
feed.summary: LiveWire officially opened reservations for the production version of its S2 Del Mar electric motorcycle in the U.S. on September 27, 2022. This date also marked LiveWire becoming the first publicly-traded electric motorcycle company in the U.S., listed on the NYSE. The S2 Del Mar features 80 horsepower, 110 miles city range, and an MSRP of $16,999, with priority deliveries expected in Spring 2023.
